title: YouTube settles with Trump for $24.5M
shortDescription: YouTube pays $24.5M to settle lawsuit after suspending Trump’s account post-Jan. 6 riots.

title: Environmental enforcement drops to a new low in Trump administration
shortDescription: Trump EPA started 14 lawsuits against companies for environmental violations, the fewest in any six-month period this century and below Biden numbers

title: Trump and Dems fail to reach deal
shortDescription: President Donald Trump and Democrats failed to reach deal as the government shutdown deadline nears.

title: YouTube agrees to pay Trump $24.5M to settle lawsuit
shortDescription: YouTube has agreed to pay $24.5 million to settle a lawsuit Trump brought against the platform after his account was suspended after Jan. 6 riots.

title: Trump unveils Gaza peace plan
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said he and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Nethanyahu have reached a deal to end the war in Gaza. Will Hamas agree?

title: No deal? Government shutdown looms after failed meeting with Trump and Dems
shortDescription: President Donald Trump failed to strike an agreement with congressional leaders to keep the government funded.

title: Trump releases US plan to end war in Gaza with warning to Hamas
shortDescription: President Trump says he and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu have reached a deal to end the war in Gaza. Will Hamas agree?

title: Was Thomas Jacob Sanford a Trump supporter? What we know
shortDescription: Thomas Jacob Sanford is the suspect in the Michigan LDS church shooting. His political beliefs are not clear but he had a Trump sign in his year.

title: Will there be a government shutdown? All eyes on Trump and Democrats
shortDescription: In talk show appearances ahead of a sit-down with Trump to hash out the looming government shutdown, both sides continued digging in their heels.

title: Is Bad Bunny a Trump supporter? Here is what he said ahead of election
shortDescription: Puerto Rican star Bad Bunny is performing at the Super Bowl in February. He has not backed President Donald Trump in the last two elections.

title: President Trump threatens movie tariffs again
shortDescription: Donald Trump vows 100% tariffs on all foreign-made films, reigniting tensions with Hollywood.

title: After Comey indictment, Trump says other opponents are next
shortDescription: After James Comey's indictment, Trump and Vice President JD Vance say more charges are expected against people who investigated the president.

title: Chicago protest targets Trump policies
shortDescription: Protesters in Chicago marched to oppose Trump’s federal crackdowns, with authorities meeting some with aggression.

title: Trump repeats threat to impose 100% tariffs on movies made abroad
shortDescription: Trump repeated a threat to impose 100% tariffs on movies made abroad, with a goal of returning movie production to the U.S.

title: European Ryder Cup winners taunt Trump with chant, trophy
shortDescription: The European team led by star golfers Rory McIlroy and Justin Rose posted a video online brandishing the Ryder Cup trophy and taunting Trump.

title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams ends re-election bid
shortDescription: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has ended his long-shot bid to run for a second term leading the nation's largest city.

title: Trump calls church shooting in Michigan 'horrendous'
shortDescription: The shooting occurred as hundreds of people were attending Sunday service at The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc, Michigan.

title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams ends long-shot reelection bid
shortDescription: Without Adams, former Gov. Andrew Cuomo likely gets a more favorable rematch against Zohran Mamdani in the November general election.

title: Trump to send troops to Portland, Oregon
shortDescription: Trump said on social media he's sending troops to Portland, Oregon, to protect immigration facilities. Oregon officials call the action illegal and unwarranted.

title: Vance tells Russia to 'wake up,' echoing Trump's shift in tone
shortDescription: Vice President JD Vance said on Fox News Sunday that Moscow needs to "wake up and accept reality," as the Trump administration tries to end the war.

title: Trump plans to attend all-hands meeting of top military leaders
shortDescription: The president will attend the mystery, last-minute meeting of the military's top brass on Sept. 30.
